clinical_study.brief_title: New Echocardiographic Parameters for Assessment of Longitudinal Left Ventricular Function
clinical_study.official_title: New Echocardiographic Parameters for Assessment of Longitudinal Left Ventricular Function

brief_summary.textblock:
Assessment of left ventricular systolic function is the most frequent indication for routine echocardiography. Qualitative eyeball method and biplane modified Simpson's rule, both measuring radial ventricular function, are the currently recommended methods to meet this challenge. Due to the complexity of the myocardial architecture, global left ventricular function also has longitudinal and torsional components.
The aim of this study is to evaluate new echocardiographic parameters for longitudinal left ventricular function. A special focus is set on strain imaging by speckle tracking, which is a relatively new technique. Patients with different cardiac pathologies (e. g. dilated cardiomyopathy, coronary artery disease, diastolic dysfunction) will be included and compared to healthy individuals.

primary_outcome.measure: left ventricular longitudinal systolic strain (LV-LSS) in all patients
primary_outcome.description: left ventricular longitudinal systolic strain (LV-LSS) is measured in all patients by speckle tracking strain imaging

secondary_outcome.measure: mitral annular plane systolic excursion (MAPSE) in all patients
secondary_outcome.description: MAPSE is measured by M-Mode echocardiography

secondary_outcome.measure: mitral annular systolic velocity (MASV) in all patients
secondary_outcome.description: MASV is derived from tissue doppler

secondary_outcome.measure: diastolic left ventricular function in all patients
secondary_outcome.description: Diastolic function is assesed by mitral inflow, mitral annulus velocity, pulmonary vein flow and velocity of flow progression.

secondary_outcome.measure: pulmonary artery systolic pressure (PASP) in all patients
secondary_outcome.description: PASP is derived from Tricuspid valve regurgitation velocity

secondary_outcome.measure: left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) in all patients
secondary_outcome.description: EF is measured by modified Simpson's rule (biplane)

arm_group.description: Healthy individuals without structural heart disease
Patients with cardiac manifestation of amyloidosis
Patients with heart failure with preserved ejection fraction (diastolic heart failure)

study_pop.textblock: Healthy individuals and patients with various cardiac pathologies, who undergo routine echocardiography at our department

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- persons of 18 years and older who receive a transthoracic echocardiography at our department
- written consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- permanent pacemaker rhythm
- moderate/severe valvular heart disease
